hypotheses.description: Cues of kinship will increase prosocial behaviour. Cues of kinship will be manipulated by morphed  facial self-resemblance. Prosocial behaviour will be measured by responses in the trust game. The prediction is that the number of trusting AND/OR reciprocating moves will be greater to self morphs than to other morphs.

corroboration.description: The hypothesis is corroborated if the 97.5% CI lower bound is greater than 0 and the 97.5% CI upper bound is greater than 0.2 (the SESOI) for either the trust or reciprocation moves.

falsify.description: The hypothesis is falsified if the 97.5% CI upper bound is smaller than 0.2 (the SESOI) for both trust and reciprocation.

codebook.name: trust_self
codebook.description: Number of trusting moves towards self-morphs

codebook.name: trust_other
codebook.description: Number of trusting moves towards self-morphs

codebook.name: recip_self
codebook.description: Number of reciprocating moves towards other-morphs

codebook.name: recip_other
codebook.description: Number of reciprocating moves towards other-morphs
